DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version Initiate Scale T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Initiate Scale in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Adult Version Initiate Scale T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized measure that assesses the executive functions of adults aged 18-90 years in their everyday environment. Both a self-report and an informant report are used._A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that reflects an individual's ability to begin a task or activity and to independently generate ideas, responses, or problem-solving strategies._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Adult Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized measure that assesses the executive functions of adults aged 18-90 years in their everyday environment. Both a self-report and an informant report are used.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Adult Version
Concepts.definition: A standardized measure that assesses the executive functions of adults aged 18-90 years in their everyday environment. Both a self-report and an informant report are used.

Property.preferredDefinition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that reflects an individual's ability to begin a task or activity and to independently generate ideas, responses, or problem-solving strategies.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function that reflects an individual's ability to begin a task or activity and to independently generate ideas, responses, or problem-solving strategies.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BRIEF-A:Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version. Robert M. Roth, PhD, Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, Lutz, FL, 2005
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 4/2/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
